intro: Saurauia chewlunii, commonly known as the Sikkim saurauia, is a species of flowering plant in the family Ericaceae. It is native to the eastern Himalayas, specifically found in regions of India, Nepal, and Bhutan. The plant is characterized by its evergreen leaves and clusters of small, bell-shaped flowers that typically bloom in the spring. It thrives in cool, moist environments at high altitudes, often growing in mountain forests. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
